id: Daily Keyno And Warm Regards-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Daily Keyno And Warm Regards
description:
Valhalla - 154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington present -

Daily Keyno & Warm Regards performing on Wednesday the 16th of July.

DOORS OPEN: 7.30pm
Warm Regards: 8.30pm
Daily Keyno: 9.30pm

Daily Keyno, the brain child of Mark Sommerville, is proud to announce the release of their debut album, That’s my jc, available on all major streaming platforms starting September 25th..

That’s my jc is a personal project, featuring 8 tracks that explore themes of love, loneliness, fatherhood, past reflections. The album showcases Daily Keyno’s signature spacious, crystal like guitar, while pushing into new sonic territory.

Lead singles like Sunlight. Sugar and Peaches & Creme have already garnered critical acclaim, with Sunlight. Sugar was praised by Glen Thurston of Music, Movies & Madness as A lot of fun, a dreamy musical experience. The album also features the slick rhythm section of Riki Gooch, Jacqui Nyman, and Dayle Jellyman

This album is a reflection of where I am creatively and emotionally right now, says Sommerville. I wanted to make something sincere and sonically simple/minimal.

Leading up to the release, Daily Keyno will be performing -

July 16th - Valhalla, Te Whanganui a tara

Tracklist for That’s my jc:

1. Ocean Blue
2. My beautifully sad walk home
3. Birth
4. Days drag
5. My love is shining
6. Sunlight. Sugar
7. Dayle on the record
8. Peaches & Creme

Warm Regards are a Te Whanganui-a-Tara based country dream-rock band.

They are great mates, and have over 150 years of experience playing in bands and being human beings.

They are super pumped to be playing with their friends Daily Keyno at Valhalla - it’s going to be a great night!!

They recently released this song. Listen to it!!

id: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children - 'Backroom Smooches' Tour-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children - 'Backroom Smooches' Tour
description:
Diesel Jenny and Synthetic Children announce ‘Backroom Smooches’ tour

Two of Aotearoa’s most rungle hardware acts are joining forces for a mid-winter tour across the country this July. Armed with new releases and a reckless lack of MIDI cables, longtime pals Synthetic Children and Diesel Jenny are packing gear into the whip for a trip up and down the motu.
The six-date tour will see the pair serve up their respective dishes in Ōtautahi, Ōtepoti, Tāmaki Makaurau, Pōneke, Te Papaioea, and Whanganui. Joined by local favourites, the tour will bring the sounds of provincial Aotearoa to the big smoke. To pair will also make a special stop in at the legendary Tūrangi dairy ‘Sanjay’s Selection’, to spin some tunes through the most bass boosted speakers in the Waikato.

Via hardware synths and drum machines, Synthetic Children (Te Papaioea’s Celina Goacher) is bringing bubbly synths, auto-tuned vulnerabilities, and sub-rattling beats. Her latest Smooch EP, and appearance on the Big Fresh Collective’s Footmahi compilation, show an emerging fun side to her dancefloor arsenal, following the murky weight of 2023’s Everything’s Perpetual. Donnys worldwide have heralded the new release as a “freshly cooked 3 course meal, served up by Palmy’s premier snack pack herself”. Think wonky hyperpop with plenty of low end.

Diesel Jenny’s (Pōneke’s Josh Finegan) live set will blend brain-breaking breaks with sugar-rush synths and 3D club energy years. This tour will celebrate the inaugural release of Diesel Jenny’s white label series with a rock-solid RUC-exempt two-tracker. With multiple releases on underground mainstays Big Fresh Collective and Bankrupt Records as ABG, this isn’t the first time Diesel Jenny’s revved the engine.

Diesel Jenny and Synthetic Children ‘Backroom Smooches’ Tour:
4 July – Ōtautahi – Flux* (with BWD)
5 July – Ōtepoti – Yours (supports TBA)
11 July - Tūrangi – Sanjay’s Selection (DJ sets b2b Skymning)
12 July – Tāmaki Makaurau – Audio Foundation (with Baby Zionov)
17 July – Pōneke – Valhalla (with Ekho Lahlia)
18 July – Te Papaioea – Snails (with Club Tremaine, Cradle)
19 July – Whanganui – Porridge Watson (with Alphabethead, Club Tremaine)
Tickets available from undertheradar.co.nz *Tickets from flicket.co.nz

id: The Superjesus With The After - Aotearoa Tour - July 2025-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: The Superjesus With The After - Aotearoa Tour - July 2025
description:
TICKETS: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/
THE SUPERJESUS - A long career in the music industry is much of a rarity these days but Adelaide rockers The Superjesus have managed to hold their place as one of Australia’s most respected live bands for almost 30 years.

Emerging in the late 90’s and signing to Warners worldwide they released 3 classic albums, Sumo, Jet Age and Rock Music, two of which went platinum. The 3 x Aria award winners took a hiatus in the mid 2000’s to work on solo projects and re-emerged in 2013 to test the waters. Pleased to have found themselves well received by the public they headed back into the studio for 2016’s EP Love And Violence followed by a double live album.

The South Australian Music Hall Of Fame inductees have a strong work ethic and an ear for a good hook. With hits such as ‘Gravity’ , ‘Secret Agent Man’, ‘Down Again’ & ‘Now And Then’ under their belt their songwriting has always remained their strong point. It has been 20 years since The Superjesus have released a full-length album of new music. In 2025 the band released their first self-titled album ‘The Superjesus’. After 30 years of crafting their sound, the songwriting partnership of Sarah McLeod & Stuart Rudd has truly found its sweet spot.

Rudd say’s “our writing partnership together has blossomed into a fantastic place to be creative. McLeod backed this up with “When you find a great creative writing partner, stick with it” From the opening bars of ‘Starlight’ we hear classic TSJ, tipping the hat to the 90’s sound they are known for while surging forward lyrically & melodically to create something really special.

This is the new Superjesus, a more soulful engaging version of the band we know and love where song writing is king. To date 5 singles have been released from the forthcoming self-titled album “Money (We’re Only In It For Love), ‘Lights Out’, ‘We Won’t Let Go Until It’s Over’, ‘Something Good’ & a cover of Generation X’s ‘Dancing With Myself’. All 5 singles have gained national airplay, setting the mood for this highly anticipated release.

They have kept the beautiful ballad ‘Diamonds’ to accompany the release. Here we see The Superjesus like never before, a beautiful emotive stirrer written on the piano showcasing how far the band has come musically, coupled with Sarah McLeod's classic rich vocals. The Superjesus are back stronger than ever and according to Rudd “not going anywhere anytime soon” . McLeod said “For us the magic is in the creation of the music & as a band we have found this process very soul enriching, I truly feel it’s our best work yet, I love every song on this record ”.

Supporting TSJ on the NZ shows is NZ’s THE AFTER.
The After are a pop/rock band blending moody grooves, gritty guitars & soaring melodies into emotionally charged soundscapes. Already two massive Asia Pacific tours under their belt, a string of NZ tours, significant airplay & video successes; The After are a well-oiled live act with a fast-growing international reputation. At the helm is the magnetic Ruby Fraser, whose powerhouse vocals and searing guitar work channel raw emotion & rebellious spirit. Founding member Andrew Featherstone lays the groundwork on bass with tight, tasteful songwriting. Behind the kit, Gareth Scott delivers versatile, thunderous rhythms, while Bruce Madden—a true Hammond organ virtuoso—elevates the band’s sound with lush swells & soul-soaked textures rarely heard in modern pop/rock.

Singles co-produced & mixed by Steve James (Screaming Jets, Sex Pistols), latest track “Mesmerised” mastered by Leon Zervos (INXS, AC/DC, Pink). • ‘Mesmerised’ radio & TV in NZ & the Philippines • ‘Clear to Me’ (feat. Split Enz legend Eddie Rayner) the most-played rock track NZ’s Juice TV in 2021, airing on 500 stations worldwide.• ‘Doesn’t Matter’ Radioscope Top 40 & a JUICE TV staple. • ‘Where There’s a Will, There’s a Way’ 600k views, video shot in Tokyo, Manila, Hong Kong, Singapore, & Auckland. • cover of Filipinos Dilaw’s hit “Uhaw” 500k views.

id: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane-Rogue and Vagabond, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane
description:
Join us for a powerful evening of music celebrating the legacy of one of jazz’s most visionary artists — John Coltrane. From his soulful early ballads and hard bop classics to the boundary-pushing spiritual intensity of his later free jazz works, this performance traces the full arc of Coltrane’s musical journey.



Led by drummer Oscar Garvie, the group is anchored by the expressive and deeply studied playing of saxophonist Isaac Randel, whose sound channels the fire and depth of Coltrane’s voice. Randel brings a commanding front-line presence and a profound connection to the material, making him the perfect interpreter of Coltrane’s vast and evolving musical language.



The band also features Jack Harris on bass and Tane Kelly on piano — a dynamic rhythm section that navigates the full emotional and sonic range of Coltrane’s music.



Together, this quartet dives into every era of Coltrane’s work — from the lyrical beauty of Naima and the modal mastery of Impressions, to the raw, transcendent fire of Ascension and Interstellar Space. This tribute isn’t just a look back — it’s a living, breathing expression of what Coltrane’s music still means

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

id: Double Trouble: An Evening of Singer/Songwriter Duos-The Pow Wow Room, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Double Trouble: An Evening of Singer/Songwriter Duos
description:
Double, double, toil and trouble! Come seek refuge from the cold winter night as we get the fires burning and cauldrons bubbling at Pow Wow!

You'll be in for a night of the best duo acts that Wellington has to offer, with tunes ranging from hackneyed old favourites to cutting-edge originals. Get ready to sing, dance, drink and leave the bitter Wellington cold at the door!

About our acts:

Plaid Moon Rising:
UVSH's own Wolf Truong joins longtime friend and talented singer/instrumentalist Daniela Butterfield to bring you Plaid Moon Rising, your friendly neighbourhood covers duo! Sit back and relax for some easy listening as these plaid-wearing nerds give you harmony-laden acoustic renditions of your favourite folk rock tunes. Featuring hits from music greats including Cat Stevens, Paul Simon, Credence Clearwater Revival and Fleetwood Mac, there's bound to be something for everyone!

Yellow Rooms:
Yellow Rooms are Pōneke based sister duo Sarah and Grace Lawrence. The sisters swap between the violin, guitar, keys and vocals on songs that are both soulful and witty. Look out for their new release ‘Cool’ in the coming months!

The Footnotes:
The Footnotes are Wellington’s first ever 4-piece band with only 2 members featuring the inimitable talents of local legends, Theo Sekeris (guitar and bass, simultaneously) and Vorn Colgan (accordion and drums, simultaneously). Demonstrably the best pound-for-pound party band in the land!

id: 'Chemical' Acoustic Concert-Te Auaha, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: 'Chemical' Acoustic Concert
description:
In anticipation of the release of her next single, Emma Kate presents an intimate acoustic showcase of original music, stripping back previously released songs to share how they were first conceived.

Bio:
Emma Kate is a confessional and open singer-songwriter who captivates listeners with her raw, heartfelt lyrics. Writing songs for the yearners, the existential dreamers, the hopeless romantics and those who love too deep; Emma Kate's music is a diary-shaped window into her most personal experiences. Relatable and authentic, she writes songs about everything; from crash-out moments to inevitable heartbreaks. Listeners can guarantee that her straight-to-the-point lyrics will hit them right in the heart - "why'd you go and throw away the best thing that you ever had?" (Invisible Broken Hearts).

Beginning her songwriting journey at just 8 years old, Emma Kate blends catchy pop melodies with descriptive storytelling. A truly unique voice from New Zealand, she's only just getting started. Listeners should be ready (and excited) for her next chapter.

id: Delaney Davidson Anniversary Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Delaney Davidson Anniversary Tour
description:
Banished Music proudly presents
Delaney Davidson
Anniversary Tour 2025, With Support From Hemi Hemingway

With multiple album Anniversaries this year, Delaney Davidson takes to the road in July to celebrate his extensive and star studded catalogue with special band The Anniversaries.
Generally dealing with the darker side of things, Delaney Davidson has been described as “being the reigning king of capturing the essence of “Noir” in Country and Folk Music, pushing at the framework and preconceptions of roots music with his brand of modern gothic Americana.” (Post to Wire).
Having spent the last 20 years as travelling “troubadour” around the globe, sometimes solo, sometimes with accomplices, but always with his Ghost Orchestra, Delaney Davidson has found new focus embracing a love of Aotearoa.
Through his collaborative work with Troy Kingi “ Black Sea, Golden Ladder”, his visual art work with Tame Iti, and his most current album “Out Of My Head” produced by Merk, he has featured such varied talents as Hayley Westenra and Reb Fountain and has toured with Chamber Music New Zealand - all the while continuing to reinvent concepts and challenge expectations, and gaining respect and admiration from audiences.
“Incontestably one of Aotearoa’s most influential and lauded contemporary songwriters” Under The Radar
Delaney Davidson now takes his band of Anniversaries on the local roads around Aotearoa, don’t miss a night of wry sense of humour, some theatre of unease, and a rocking collection of bangers from his extensive back catalogue as he celebrates the music that got him where he is today.
Pre-sale tickets – 9am, Friday 21 March
General tickets – 9am, Monday 24 March
Tickets from Banished Music
Subscribe to presale at: www.banishedmusic.com/subscribe

id: Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes - Parisian Swing Trio-Thistle Inn, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes - Parisian Swing Trio
description:
Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are Les Tripes (french for The Guts) ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson-Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson
description:
The next concert in our series presents a new project by Dave Wilson titled Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation. This project brings together a collective of musicians from across the music communities of Pōneke in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like.

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity, and celebrates a commitment to both collaboration and the distinct expression of each individual.

Ranging from contemplative minimalism to ecstatic ensemble energy and body-moving grooves, the music of Free, Free invites musicians and other listeners to tend to each moment, making their own offerings to shape the collective sound.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. With his 2023 album Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, he was a finalist for Te Manu Taki Tautito o te Tau | Best Jazz Artist at the Aotearoa Music Awards, and for the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation
Dave Wilson, Tyaan Singh – alto saxophone
Louisa Williamson – tenor saxophone
Monique Lapins, Mana Waiariki – violin
Ken Ichinose – cello
Kaito Walley, Natania Ngawhau – trombone
Ben Hunt – trumpet
Daniel Hayles, Andrew Faleatua – piano and keyboard
Phoebe Johnson – bass
Callum Allardice – guitar
Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa – drums

The performance will begin with an opening set by Flute Journeys, an offbeat mass flute ensemble with the self-described playing abilities of 5–12-year-olds, embodying a form of liberation in music.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to CNZ for their generous support. See less

id: The Wooden Box Band Broken River Album Release-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: The Wooden Box Band Broken River Album Release
description:
Join the Wooden Box Band to celebrate the launch of their latest album Broken River.
Recorded under the expert guidance of Lee Prebble at the Surgery in Newtown.

Written over the course of several years, the songs of Broken River tell stories of turbulence, change, immense loss and hope. They remind us to commune with our natural world and to remain steadfast in our commitments to each other.

Come together, join us in music. A salve to thrive in these confounding times, and to build the community we need.

id: Harvest Moon - 19 July-Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Harvest Moon - 19 July
description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 19 July 2025
Americana and Country music band Harvest Moon feature a dazzling array of instruments including pedal steel, mandolin, guitars, banjo, accordion, and dobro, playing a diverse collection of classics from legends like Johnny Cash, John Prine, Dwight Yoakam, and Neil Young. The Wellington-based band’s front-man, lead vocalist Rob Reid provides a powerful and smooth singing style. Founding member & multi instrumentalist Garrett Evans plays pedal steel, dobro, guitars and sings vocals too. Dave Allen is Harvest Moon’s lead guitarist and banjo player - he also plays in Salty Hearts, and Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Show. Another original member, Wayne Mills plays keys, accordion, bass and sings. A veteran of NZ’s vibrant 60s and 70s music scene, bassist Frits Stigter brings a wealth of experience and groove. On percussion - Robert Antonio is another well-known personality in the close-knit Wellington musical scene.
Come along to this special space and enjoy these guys playing up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $40
Please reserve a seat via the Hilltop website.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

name: My Pleasure By Bri Louise w/ Tui The Band And John Paul Jr.
description:
It is My Pleasure to invite you to a Bri Louise single release event for their new single “My Pleasure.” on the 19th of July starting at 9:30pm at The Rogue and Vagabond.

Bri Louise band consists of Bri Louise (vocal/keys), Molly Wyatt (flute/vocals), Becky Devine (bass), Theo Thompson (guitar), Eloise Edmond (Saxophone) and Ateo Buhne (drums). Bri Louise's band blends sultry queer R&B with smooth jazz and undeniable groove. Bri’s sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, R&B.

Supporting acts:

Tui the Band - a three piece Hi-Tek reggae band consisting of bassist Becky Devine, drummer Harper Champion and vocalist/guitarist Harry Young. The band merges electronic explorations with reggae making a unique experience spanning the many dialects of dub music. Echo drenched skanks meet heavy basslines and repetitive drum grooves that are bound to make you dance slow, low and easy!

John Paul Jr. - a DJ, musician, and producer from Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Drawing from soulful underground sounds, he fuses the warmth of boogie, jazz dance, rare disco, dub, and global rhythms with deep, percussive energy built for the dancers.

id: Polar Extremes Album Release w. Bottom Bunk Club + The Rugs-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Polar Extremes Album Release w. Bottom Bunk Club + The Rugs
description:
Polar Extremes is the sci-fi infused, post-modern satirical, apocalyptic musical endeavour of Auckland based creative Quaint.
Shrouded in mystery, Quaint was purposefully restrained in online presence, but has been a driving force in New Zealand’s underground scene since the 1990s, when eclectic performances across Wellington, and the songwriting of his debut record STRANGE VISIONS 1, began.
The first installment of a swirling trilogy detailing the apocalypse, STRANGE VISIONS 1 briefly emerged in 2019 and caught the eye of NZ music critics such as Graham Reid, who described the work as “fun, surreal, clever, fantasy-full, adultly childish (and vice-versa).”
In 2025, with the musical world-building of Polar Extremes as relevant as ever, STRANGE VISIONS 1 has re-emerged for an official release via digital streaming platforms.
The self-produced, mixed and mastered 12-track record paints a surreal scene for an uncertain future, but all signs point to Quaint nearing the completion of his fanciful trilogy. When? No-one knows!
**This event also features the multi-faceted talents of 'Bottom Bunk Club' and 'The Rugs'
***Doors will open by 8pm, and the performances will commence soon after!

id: Songwriter Showcase #104-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Songwriter Showcase #104
description:
Songwriter Showcase presents showcase #104, Sun July 20th at Moon bar in Newtown.

Every month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present our big busy Midwinter Massive, four great acts.. The Overdogs, The Kingston High All Stars, Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo and Janet Muggeridge and Dave Murphy.


The Overdogs
Literate ballads and breezy Americana. Hoe-down stompers on request.
Wellington combo The Overdogs have been playing round the city since 2016. Fronted by poet and songwriter John Newton, with clarinet and fiddle twins Andy Horwood and Jude Douglas, Tony Paine on bass and Liam Prince on drums. Expect dynamic playing and an easy-going vibe, thoughtful tear-in-your-craft-beer ballads and up-tempo country wig-outs.


Kingston High All Stars
Poneke based band weaving the sounds of Sahara Blues, 60s psychedelia and Traditional middle eastern music to create a tapestry of sound to transport listeners to far flung places and times.


BuffaloBuffaloBuffalo
Morphed from a project set up 2 years ago, a herd of instrument addicts with an EP imminent. Buffalo-pop-rock, whimsical, catchy, playful. Songs of road trips, relationships and reality tv.


Janet Muggeridge and Dave Murphy.
When Taranaki’s premier folk mandolinist and habitual jammer teamed up with Wellington blues legend Dave Murphy a number of years ago, they created a unique sound.
At Moon they will present their original songs that have been arranged to showcase their musical strengths. Expect songs from Dave’s time touring on the road, a blues or two, songs about trains, places in Taranaki that are important to Janet.

KULT is a tribute to electronic music, a night where local techno artists meet the raw energy of Europe’s rave culture, and where we could all celebrate what matters.
KULT is more than a party – it's a moment of sharing, an underground techno experience built on freedom, inclusivity, and the love for music.
Join a team where judgment doesn’t exist, the passion of techno music never stops.

id: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 1-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 1
description:
Anthony Donaldson is one of this country's great drummers a pioneer of improvised music in Aotearoa. A visual artist before becoming a musician, Anthony's starting point on the drums was in finding tonal colours, rhythms that come from nature, and constructing a drum kit that grew like a living sculpture, Beginning in the late 70s and early 80s with Primitive Art Group, his music making has always centred on free improvisation and collective composition. His musical journey has seen him perform with countless ensembles, often of his own creation, including the Black Sheep, Six Volts, Razorblades, Mean Bones, Flower Orphans, Teeth, Devils Gate Outfit, Rubbernecks, Farewell Spit, Melancholy Babes and the Stinging Nettles. He has been a creative force in Wellington music for over four decades and continues to push the boundaries of accepted musical norms, while encouraging and mentoring younger players.

Pyramid Club is very happy to host Anthony for two nights, performing solo and in collaboration with a large number of outstanding musicians. Gifted with a sparkling musical imagination, alongside his drum kit Anthony will be performing with electronics, 78rpm phonograph player, assorted percussion and spoken word.

For the first of his two night performance residency Anthony will be performing solo and in collaboration with:
trio with Nell Thomas (electronics) / David Long (guitar)
trio with David Donaldson (bass banjo) / Steve Roche (brass)
trio with Jonny Marks (Synthi AKS) / Daniel Beban (reel-to-reel)

Listen here to a recent Dancing in Your Head podcast featuring Anthony playing some of his own music and tracks which he's been listening to.

And to his feature on RNZ's Mixtape a few years back

Radar Angel are a four-piece synthfoolery ensemble who blend industrial grit with lush nostalgic sounds from the dawn of the digital age, all with a lavish theatricality and pop sensibility that is guaranteed to get your limbs thrashing.

The Blue Summer are a five-piece surrounding themselves with wisps of funk, post punk, alternative rock, and pop. Like a wave crashing upon the rocks, chaotic and multi-faceted, only to pull back exposing the calm of the depths below. Gracefully twisting and changing shape from ballads to bangers.

Featuring members of Murgatroyd and Opium Eater, Sighthound comes from a pedigree of noise makers. Blending trip hop, lush atmospheres and harsh noise, Sighthound promise a truly unique experience from two proficient maniacs.

name: Interlopers
description:
Interlopers will stand out at Vogelmorn Upstairs on July 26th, but we're sure they'll fit right into this gorgeous venue's shagpile vibe.

Following a memorable city debut at the Undercurrent, the quartet return with their fully-formed set of acoustic indie pop songs and stories. And tickets are priced like a bottle of bachelor wine!

Interlopers are based around the long-gestating songbook of Andrew Armitage and mellifluous cello and vocals of Sarah Laing, backed by the solid sync of Phil Peleton on bass and David Morgan on percussion.

Mr. Morgan described their drummer-less incarnation as 'The Front Lawn' meets 'Violent Femmes' so they had no choice but to let him join. A few post-punk covers are thrown in for good measure, but their focus is on time-honoured song craft with a good measure of wit and wisdom.

id: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell - 26 July-Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell - 26 July
description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 26 July 2025
Auckland based Albi/Chris Dent is an earthy songwriter who keeps both feet on the ground while being expressive and heartfelt in his stories and music.
His appearance is striking as he wields his albinism with pride in the form of a big white beard. His voice too isn’t quite what you’d expect. More smooth, more pronounced, and more powerful than his rough exterior may evoke. Chris grew up in rural New Zealand and likes to tell tales about the little things, as those are what make our lives rich and full. He’s mostly performed with award-winning indie-folk band Albi & The Wolves but has written songs in many different projects, including a collaboration with Mt Eden Dubstep that has amassed over one million streams, or his side project Sneakers which has a single with over 750,000 streams.
Whether it’s on the stage or off, Chris is known for his work ethic and as he sets out on a new journey, quietly creating new solo music, he’s excited to see where that leads. For this show, Chris will be joined by the accomplished musician Hannah Morrell on the violin and maybe even the banjo. She is a seasoned touring musician who hails from Tasmania, Australia and has performed with the likes of The Dead Maggies (TAS), Claire Anne Taylor (TAS), Looking For Alaska, Finn Johanson, Holly Arrowsmith, and Jess Bailey (Fables).

id: Princess Chelsea's Midwinter Ball-Meow Nui, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Princess Chelsea's Midwinter Ball
description:
PRINCESS CHELSEA’S MIDWINTER BALL
SWORDS AND SORCERY - Fantasy on The Big Screen
with your host TOM SAINSBURY

SATURDAY 19 JULY - WINTERGARDEN, THE CIVIC, AUCKLAND (ALL AGES) *
SATURDAY 26 JULY - MEOW NUI, WELLINGTON **

With special guests THE CIRCLING SUN & GOLDEN AXE *
GRECCO ROMANK & LUKE BUDA **

‘The Wintergarden will host many, many more incredible events, but it will never host something like the mesmerising Princess Chelsea and Twin Peaks crossover again’ - Rolling Stone

This winter, the Civic Wintergarden (ALL AGES) and Meow Nui (18+) Wellington will be transformed into a world of fantasy! Princess Chelsea’s Midwinter Ball returns, this year with a new theme: SWORDS AND SORCERY - Fantasy on The Big Screen. With your esteemed host comedian Tom Sainsbury, and live performances from Princess Chelsea & The Dream Warriors in both centres, with Auckland guests The Circling Sun & Golden Axe, while Wellington will be treated to sets from Grecco Romank & Luke Buda.

In the shimmering and VHS-heavy age of the early 1980s, a treasure trove of cinematic fantasy was thrust upon us. Gleaming swords and potent spells in Excalibur, the ethereal beauty and terror of Legend, valiant quests of The Sword and The Sorcerer, Ladyhawke, The Beastmaster, Willow, Dragonslayer, and the mighty & muscular quests of Conan The Barbarian. And let us not forget the timeless enchantments of pure fantasy with The Neverending Story, the delightful Princess Bride, the poignant Last Unicorn, and the unforgettable shape of Labyrinth.

So, brave adventurers, will you join us to celebrate this golden age? How will you dress to impress as visions of enchanted lands and heroic feats conjure a costume fit for fantasy?

Called by many as ‘the show of 2024’, last year’s Twin Peaks themed Midwinter Ball was a revelation, and a dress up party for the ages. A sold out Wintergarden heaved with 650 guests dressed as Log Ladies, Agent Dale Coopers, and even a giant slice of cherry pie… and oh, so much more.

Princess Chelsea and her band The Dream Warriors delighted the audience with a blazing set of originals alongside covers of Julee Cruise, Angelo Badalamenti and In Heaven from Lynch’s Eraserhead. This wild and unforgettable night has been lovingly captured and presented as a four song tribute to David Lynch, due for imminent release.
For 2024’s Twin Peaks-themed ball, no expenses were spared on transforming the venue into the quaint town of Twin Peaks. Decoration which featured lasers, an indoor pine forest, a shrine to Laura Palmer and a replica of the infamous Red Room, we can only expect magic and mystery from 2025’s fantasy- themed ball.

“I’m not giving too much away but obviously we will need a medieval sword fight” - Princess Chelsea

If last year’s ball was anything to go by, I don't think she is joking - and further shenanigans will undoubtedly ensue. Expect the Civic and Meow Nui to be transformed into a world of fantasy.

Earlybird tickets are on sale Friday at 10am. Book your evening, and swan down the red carpet dressed in your favourite fantasy-inspired outfits. Portraits will be taken on the night, and prizes for best dressed.

id: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne-Common Ground, Featherston, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne
description:
vegetable.machine.animal - 'Guest' album release gig
featuring
vegetable.machine.animal
indigogue browne

vegetable.machine.animal
A live conversation between plants, fungi, machines, and human musicians
What would it sound like if we could interact musically with plants and fungi—if humans stopped to listen and respond?
vegetable.machine.animal is an interspecies improvisational trio exploring this question through a hybrid sonic language of biosignals, modular synthesis, and live drums.
Led by drummer Kieran Monaghan, the project transforms living data from plants and fungi into voltage, translated into sound via modular synthesizer. Monaghan responds in real time, creating a feedback loop between human, organism, and machine.

Their debut album, GUEST, was recorded during the 2024 Sonic Artist Residency (Creative New Zealand / NZSM / Toi Pōneke) and emerged through open-ended, intuitive sessions. A diverse group of collaborators was invited to join the process, including Kedron Parker, Nico Buhne, Bill Wood, Ruby Solly, Indigique Brown, David Long, Andrew Faleatua, Andy Wright, Gemma Thompson, Timothy Morel, Mo H. Zareei, Tae Kyung Seo, Issac Smith, and Chrissie Butler.
Rather than guiding the music, contributors were invited to follow it—adding their voices to a living, shifting ecology of sound. The result is an album that is rhythmic, irregular, immersive, and alive.

GUEST is co-released by Audio Foundation Records (Tāmaki Makaurau) and skirted Records (Te Whanganui-a-Tara).

KIERAN MONAGHAN
Kieran Monaghan is a self-taught multi-instrumentalist, writer, recording artist and sound bogan based in Te Whanganui-A-Tara. He is a prolific creative and organiser, with an irrepressible DIY ethic, known for his experimental and innovative approach to performance and sound making. Used to drum with mr sterile Assembly

indigogue browne
guitar, detritus, synth, violin, vocals

id: Altared States: Electronic Soundscapes In A Divine Place-Old St Paul's, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Altared States: Electronic Soundscapes In A Divine Place
description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s (OSP) will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience. Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.

Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.

Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:

August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers

Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.

Tickets are available now, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.

About the Artists

Ludus

is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.

Stephen Gallagher

is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.

David Long

is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.

Jules Desmond

is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.

Oghum

is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.

Jess Chambers

is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”

About the Venue

Built in 1866, Old St Paul’s is a prime example of timber Gothic Revival architecture and one of Aotearoa’s most important historic places. Managed and operated by Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, it is a venue steeped in history and beauty.

The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

id: Funky Friday 006 - Not My Sister, Sorchalula, Mi Casa Su Casa-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Funky Friday 006 - Not My Sister, Sorchalula, Mi Casa Su Casa
description:
We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Friday Vol. 6!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.

Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.

This edition features legends Sorchalula, Mi Casa Su Casa & our host Not My Sister!

$10 presales or $15 on the door.

Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Mi Casa Su Casa
11.30-1 Sorchalula
1-2 Not My Sister

Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.

--------

Mysterious, mercurial and multi-faceted. SorchaLula has as many shades to her music as she does to her personality. A dynamic producer/DJ, she flows from slinky sensuality, to fierce filth, to the uncompromising underground. Every set features her original tracks, many melting with honeyed vocals by singer Samuel (Cecilia’s Crop). In tune with what the body needs, she entwines beauty with bravery, sinuous melodies with hefty bass, lush peaks with decadent darkness.

She has played many top festivals around Aotearoa: Northern Bass, Shipwrecked Festival, Twisted Frequency, Aum Festival NYE, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den and more. She is highly rated by some of the biggest names in the scene for her taste, depth, and intuitive understanding of dancefloors. As founder of The Sensonauts she created events exploring the senses, music, dance, and music education with a focus on inclusivity.

--------

These two scallywags have the Welly wind in their sails and a groove in their hearts.

They're the duo behind the capital's much loved club night, Mi Casa Su Casa, now rockin' for over 15 years.

They've also had the pleasure of playing some of NZ's most legendary shindigs like Shipwrecked, Off The Radar, Kiwiburn, CubaDupa, Taniwha's Den and Rhythm & Vines.

With the people on the dancefloor their inspiration, they'll share a bounty of underground house to lift you up and bring you on a journey.

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
description:
The seventh concert in our series is a new suite of music by Tāmaki Makaurau composer, performer, and educator; Callum Passells.

For the Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Callum brings new music for his ensemble LCR, an ensemble which features three identical saxophone trios (sax, bass, and drums) that play with and against each other in a kaleidoscopic and often explosive fashion. The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.

Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland. He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others. In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival. He is currently completing a Master of Music degree at the University of Auckland, where he also teaches saxophone.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix, door sales $20.

id: Salmonella Dub Soundsystem-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Salmonella Dub Soundsystem
description:
Salmonella Dub originator Andrew Penman (aka Dj Rudeboy) drives the Sal Dub SoundSystem Machine featuring the Mighty Asterix & Whirimako Black on vocals with the epic Sal Dub horn section live. Prepare for an audio visual dance floor journey through the basslands of Salmonella Dub back catalogue + new tunes from the For All Things Alive and versions featured on next release.

Look For Gold ft Whirimako Black

Salmonella Dub began writing with Whirimako Black after touring with the band on their Feel The Seasons Change live with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra summer shows of 2008. Look For Gold is the bands new 4 track EP featuring Whirimako on all four tracks. The title track Look For Gold - [I'm Coming Alive Low-Phi Rockers Dub] - ft. Whirimako Black is an unreleased dub track written during the bands For All Things Alive album sessions cross pollinating Whirimako’s Return to our Kowhai vocal with a stripped back dub of Andy’s Jam produced by Harry Bretherton.

The bands Salmonella Dub SoundSystem ft. Whirimako Black, the Mighty Asterix and Dub horns are out touring the bands new releases over May & June in preparation for the bands remastered digital back catalogue re-issue.

NOTE Under 18 permitted with Legal Guardian

id: InDuna - Go High - EP Release-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: InDuna - Go High - EP Release
description:
Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.

‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today. It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience. The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.

He will also be joined by two incredible acts:

*Tarin* is a soulful Moriori singer-songwriter from Whakatū, now based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Her sound blends dreamy R&B and soul with jazz influences, drawing inspiration from artists like Amy Winehouse and Etta James. With raw, introspective lyrics and a deeply emotive voice, Tarin delivers music that’s personal, expressive, and healing.

*KB the DJ* is a Cape Town-born selector now lighting up Aotearoa with his genre-spanning sets. On the night, KB will be serving deep Afro grooves and infectious rhythms to keep the energy high and the dancefloor moving.

Doors open: 9:00 PM
Show starts: 9:30 PM

Venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington
Moon is a wheelchair-accessible venue with both seated and standing options available.

When the NFC ticket bundle is purchased, fans will get exclusive access to a limited edition NFC-enabled EP, featuring the full EP plus unreleased demos and future tracks, delivered directly to your device before they’re available anywhere else. InDuna merchandise will also be available on the night — don’t miss it.

About InDuna:
Self-taught artist and producer InDuna blends Afro-pop with the vibrant spirit of his South African heritage. He was recently honoured with the Young Global Achiever Award at the 2024 Prince’s Trust Awards in London and recognised at Buckingham Palace by King Charles III.

His music has reached global ears, with his track ‘Dreams’, written for the documentary Ink and Gold: An Artist’s Journey to Olympic Glory, winning Best Original Song at the International Online Web Fest and climbing to #6 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart.

id: DOMUS (ESP, AU) / Juniper May-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar

Their performances reflect a fusion of their diverse influences - from lofi psychedelic to abstract electronic beats, contemporary neofolk and a merging of their respective South American and Southeast Asian heritage.

While being accomplished artists in their own right with this project they blend their sounds into a unified, compelling and resonant experience.

---

Juniper May is the latest solo project of Pōneke artist Lora May. Using an SP-404, she channels and transfigures samples of found sounds, synths and field recordings into melodic, distant and estranged pop songs.

id: Ben Chavasse Unplugged With Strings (support From Bronwyn Wilde)-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Ben Chavasse Unplugged With Strings (support From Bronwyn Wilde)
description:
Indie-folk artist Ben Chavasse is making his first trip to Wellington to celebrate the release of his first two singles. This set will feature stripped back arrangements of his songs accompanied with string arrangements performed by Karen Hu (cello), and Hijiri Yamamoto (violin).

Ben Chavasse is a 26-year-old singer-songwriter based in Tāmaki Makaurau. His lyric-forward approach embraces the indie-folk genre while incorporating rock, punk, and jazz influences. He explores themes of adolescence, mental health, and reconciliation through an introspective, reflective and vulnerable lens. Ben continues to thrive in collaboration with local musicians he met during his studies at the University of Auckland Jazz School.

Bronwyn Wilde grew up across the road from Vogelmorn and can remember performing at the Hall as early as age six (she sang the national anthem at the Ridgway school talent quest - it was not a winning song choice). Today, she is a trustee of the Vogelmorn Community Group and occasionally works behind the bar, where she has been lucky to see so many talented local musicians perform.
She has many fond memories of singing with Ben together in their flat in Auckland during the 2021 lockdown. She is thrilled to be joining him on stage at Vogelmorn, her second home.

The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer and jazz, on a Sunday perfect!

This week featuring local guitarist Callum Allardice and his trio

Join the Callum Allardice trio for some favourite standards and standard inspired originals, featuring the talents of John Rae and Eli Mulheron.

id: Shan-Cable Top Eatery, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Shan
description: SHAN is a duo so quirky, clever and in tune that you’ll want to keep watching and listening. Their music is a wonderful mix of original singer/songwriting with an energetic guitar and piano backbone. If you like Kate Bush, Bic Runga or Sia, SHAN provides vocal melodies that have the power to emulate both, soaring to the highs and braving the lows. Within each song, you’ll hear meaningful lyrics blossom from real life experiences and changing landscapes of sound.

A familiar musical face in a less familiar format, Merlin Webster is the alter ego of Newtown Rocksteady guitarist Tim Key. Strumming and singing, whistling and wailing his way through original tunes and interpretations of obscure classics, his solo sets span genres and generations. Folk, rock and blues to rocksteady reggae, a sprinkling of mo-town soul and a smattering of high-brow country. All suffused with the psychedelic soul of the sixties. Expect to feel your toes tapping, your head nodding and your vibe rising.

id: The Bitter Brothers-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: The Bitter Brothers
description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home! After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs! We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.

And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience. They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies. The Bitter Brothers bring it all and invite you along for the ride!

id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour
description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.

Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality. Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.

August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.

The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

Friday 1 August - Wunderbar, Ōhinehou
Saturday 2 August - Secret Show, Ōtepoti
Friday 8 August - Meow, Te Whanganui a-Tara
Saturday 9 August - Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau

TICKETS ON SALE NOW FROM RINGLETS.CO.NZ

id: The Carol Bean Band - 9 August-Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: The Carol Bean Band - 9 August
description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 9 August 2025
The Carol Bean Band play a mix of jazzy blues with a heavy helping of original songs and stylish instrumentation. Carol Bean – vocals and guitar, Costa Botes – guitar(s), George Packard – upright bass, and Andrew Grayson – drums.
English-born, California-raised, Carol was influenced by the West Coast music of the 60s and the blues of Mississippi John Hurt, Mance Lipscomb, Lightnin’ Hopkins, and Doc Watson. At LA’s Ash Grove and McCabe’s Music Store she was taught her picking style from a young Ry Cooder who encouraged her to buy the Martin guitar she still plays today. Carol has fronted several bands in New Zealand and recorded 3 studio albums, all on Spotify. She continues to perform at the Wellington Roomfulla Blues Club and with the Kelburn Viaduct Municipal Ensemble Jug Band.
Carol’s singing is versatile, vibrant, and delivers an earthy quality to her songs. Tom Villano, LA
… when the mood drops she reveals a more intimate, reflective side…. Graham Reid
The first three songs of Next Bus Out perfectly set the album up for the interesting journey that is to come. Nick Bollinger.
Costa is a veteran independent filmmaker with several award winning short films and feature length documentaries to his credit, including the notorious ‘mock doc’ Forgotten Silver, which he made with Peter Jackson. For the last two decades he has created a run of films celebrating individuals who are quirky, creative, passionate, and above all, persistent (Struggle No More, The Last Dogs of Winter, Act of Kindness, Angie, When The Cows Come Home). These films have included studies of musicians (Paddy Burgin's Wooden Box Band, Nigel Gavin’s Circus, and The Shot Band/ Hobnails @ The Paramount Theatre) because Costa has been a persistent closet musician himself. He has had stints with Chris and Eva Prowse, and Carol Bean's Mount Misery String Band. When he was younger, Costa wanted to move his fingers really fast. Now he just tries to put them in the right place, song by song, and man - does he ever. “Tasty”, “Amazing”, “Great playing”.
Costa Botes | NZ On Screen & Costa Botes Lone Pine Films (vimeo.com)
George is a professional musician and tutor on Whitireia Polytechnic’s Music Programme, trained classically on the cello. George’s first improvisational experiences were playing ukulele along with the Rolling Stones, John Mayall and The Band (in his bedroom). With little market for improvisational ukulele he took up the double bass.
George enjoys playing in bands that push the envelope and give expression to the human soul. He has played extensively in many Wellington groups (including currently with the Rag Poets band), appearing a number of times for the Wellington International Festival of the Arts, undertaking national tours for Chamber Music New Zealand, and backing overseas artists in New Zealand. His playing ranges from classical to jazz, to Latin, to ethnic fusion to Americana and country. He believes - at a fundamental level - that music is about human beings making sense of the world and themselves, and about helping heal the world.
Andrew is also the drummer for the band Ghostplane (Beneath the Sleepy Lagoon; Panther Valley Country Club (Arch Hill Records), which includes Phoenix Foundation members). Not only has he joined our team, but his passion is surfing - so let's say he's the youngest and the fittest.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30
Come along and enjoy this gig in our special space, up close and personal.

id: Niko Ne Zna Live (Wellington)- NZ's 9 Piece Balkan Brass Extravaganza-Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Niko Ne Zna Live (Wellington)- NZ's 9 Piece Balkan Brass Extravaganza
description:
Wellington, get ready! It’s been a minute!

Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.

Expect bold brass, infectious rhythms, soaring vocals, and a dancefloor that won’t quit. This nine-piece powerhouse delivers their signature high-energy performance — featuring brand new songs in preparation for their upcoming third studio album, as well as all the hits you know and love.

Live Balkan brass music

Delicious food available

Cash bar featuring local beers from Kererū Brewing, as well as wine and spirits from the Balkans

A party like no other

With trumpets, saxophone, trombones, sousaphone, tapan (bass drum), snare drum, percussion, and vocals in multiple languages, Niko Ne Zna blends hypnotic melodies, driving rhythms, and theatrical flair into an unforgettable live experience. Whether on the street, in a club, or on a festival stage, their shows are part gig, part spectacle — all heart.

They’ve wowed crowds at WOMAD, featured in What We Do In The Shadows, and played to packed houses across New Zealand and Australia.

Come early, grab a bite, enjoy a Kererū brew, and be part of something special.

“It’s like being dropped into the hot and spicy lands of a faraway country.” — wellingtonlivemusic.com

“Straight to the dancefloor.” — Elsewhere

“Driving rhythms, an intoxicating effect.” — Taranaki Daily News

www.nikonezna.com

id: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington
description:
Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington

Friday, August 15 @ San Fran- Wellington

With special guests Valley Kids

Loop, The Edge and Mai FM are stoked to present Corrella and their upcoming Skeletons Winter Tour!

After a massive summer of festivals and touring alongside L.A.B across Aotearoa and Australia, Corrella are hitting the road this August for their biggest headline tour yet — bringing their new album Skeletons to the stage for the very first time.

Skeletons marks the next chapter for the band as they continue to cement their place in the New Zealand and Australian music scenes. The album follows their breakout debut Road From 26, which featured the sleeper hit Blue Eyed Māori—a track that now holds the record for the most weeks ever spent at Number One on the NZ Singles Chart.

Since their debut, Corrella have sold out shows nationwide, become festival favourites, and picked up multiple Aotearoa Music Awards and Waiata Māori Music Awards.

This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date. See Corrella live as they hit the road in August for their Skeletons Winter Tour taking on Auckland's Tuning Fork, Hamilton’s Factory, Wellington’s San Fran, Christchurch’s The Church & Dunedin’s Erricks, presented by Loop. Support for each show to be announced.

id: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge Tour - 16 August-Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge Tour - 16 August
description:
Featuring songs from Linda Ronstadt & Carole King
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 16 August 2025
Sue Dyson, a gifted vocalist known for her warm and captivating stage presence, backed by talented pianist Mitch Dean to offer an extraordinary musical experience that celebrates the enduring legacies of Linda Ronstadt and Carole King. Set in Hilltop's laid-back intimate atmosphere, their performances promise an engaging experience where the audience will tap their feet to the classics that have defined generations. Sue has graced the stage of New Zealand's 'Good Morning Show' multiple times, showcasing her vocal prowess and musical versatility. Additionally, Sue has lent her voice as a backup vocalist at the prestigious New Zealand Music Awards and has enjoyed significant success with her original country music in Australia.
Mitch Dean complements Sue's voice with his extensive expertise as a guitarist and pianist, cultivated over more than 20 years of performing in diverse musical settings. Notably, he played keys and guitar in the acclaimed Wellington Fleetwood Mac Experience, contributing to their successful tour. Mitch’s deep understanding of music, combined with his skillful instrumentation, enriches the duo's sound and enhances the overall performance.
Together, Sue and Mitch create a harmonious blend of nostalgia and artistry, celebrating the timeless contributions of Ronstadt and King. Their performances promise to be an unforgettable evening of music that not only bridges generations but also stirs the soul, inviting audiences to revel in the rich tapestry of these legendary artists' works. Join them for a memorable experience that resonates long after the final note has been played.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30

id: Orangefarm and Warm Regards-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Orangefarm and Warm Regards
description:
Orangefarm and Warm Regards Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs.

Vogelmorn Upstairs comes alive on Saturday 16 August with an electric double bill featuring local favourites Warm Regards and Orangefarm.

Warm Regards is a band that epitomizes style, comfort, economy, and power — a sleek sedan equally at home on the racetrack or with the family bundled safely in the back. Blending indie rock, pop, folk, and jazz-country flair, their infectious sound and high-energy performances have earned them a dedicated local following. With frontman Tom Watson (Cassette, Terror of the Deep, HLAH) leading the charge, Warm Regards deliver introspective lyrics, tight grooves, and lush harmonies that promise an unforgettable live experience.
Orangefarm brings a distinct mix of shimmering guitars, melodic hooks, and lyrical wit that’s become their signature sound. Known for their dynamic sets and warm stage presence, the band has quietly carved out a niche as one of Wellington’s most engaging live acts.
Don’t miss this night of standout local talent in the intimate upstairs space at Vogelmorn. Doors from 7:00 PM. Music starts 8:00PM or earlier if you’re there!

id: Hihi & The Stitchbirds - On A Good Day - EP Launch-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Hihi & The Stitchbirds - On A Good Day - EP Launch
description:
Come celebrate Hihi & The Stitchbirds' first EP - On a Good Day - an exploration of love, and loss, and the pieces in between.

7:00pm - Doors

7:30pm - The Bidibids

8:30pm - Hihi & The Stitchbirds

After a whirlwind 18 months as a five-piece folk band, Hihi & The Stitchbirds are delighted to release their debut EP with five original songs that will make you feel soothed and seen. Written by band members Tess Luff, Elena Saunders and Ellie Stewart, this group of talented musicians invite you into contemplative corners of their brains with a set of gentle and jovial numbers that will entertain and delight.

They will be joined on stage by their friends the Bidibids.


About Hihi & The Stitchbirds:

Hihi & The Stitchbirds are an exciting five-piece musical experiment, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Pairing rich vocal harmonies with vibrant original music inspired by the folk and Americana playbooks, this band brings something for everyone.

Hihi & The Stitchbirds are:
Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes
Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals
Tess Luff - guitar, banjo uke and vocals
Matt Hutton - bass uke and vocals
Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals


About the Bidibids:

With lush harmonies, intricate arrangements, and beguiling melodies, the Bidibids explore what it means to play folk music in New Zealand. The Bidibids are Sarah August on banjo and guitar, Simon Carryer on cello-banjo, and Brendan Schenk on mandolin and guitar. The trio came together at the 2020 Wellington Folk Festival, where they were each supposed to be playing in different groups. Since then, the Wellington-based band have become regulars at some of the region’s best venues for folk music, including the Mussel Inn, Moon, and the Wellington Bluegrass Society.

Driven by Sarah’s honest, intimate songwriting and Brendan’s blazing musicianship, the Bidibids balance soulful ballads that will tug your heart-strings with upbeat numbers which will get your toes tapping. Influenced by American bluegrass and folk bands like Watchhouse and Nickel Creek, they’re also inspired by local acts like the Eastern and Marlon Williams who are forging an authentic New Zealand folk tradition. You can listen to the Bidibids' debut EP here: https://open.spotify.com/album/6Q8HW5g0FzDl3VYz44OZU5?si=4gIRmfaRSiOUlgxJnVUbuw.

id: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour-Old St Paul's, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour
description:
Presented by Strung Out Touring

Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour

After opening for Kasey Chambers around Australia, award-winning songwriter Jenny Mitchell returns home for a national tour celebrating her acclaimed album Forest House.

An Aotearoa Music Award Winner and 2 x Australian Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny is a gifted storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand. Now based in Melbourne, the AU Review describes Jenny’s music as a “sublime slice of folk” and her new highly anticipated album, Forest House, is capturing fans across the motu and the globe.

“Forest House - 10/10,” Newstalk ZB

Every so often, an artist emerges who has everything it takes to reach the pinnacle of country music success. Jenny Mitchell is a star.” Country Music Capital News

Jenny is thrilled to welcome very special guest Katie Thompson to The Forest House Tour. Hailing from New Zealand’s West Coast, Katie is a captivating alt-country artist known for her soul-stirring storytelling and rich, emotive voice. A 2024 finalist for Best Country Song, Katie has shared stages with legends like Sir Elton John and Don McLean, leaving lasting impressions with her raw honesty and polished edge.

WELLINGTON
? Old St Paul's
? Sunday 18 August
⏰ Doors open at 7pm
? Support from Katie Thompson

NZ TOUR DETAILS
SAT 17 AUGUST - Errick's Venue, Dunedin
SUN 18 AUGUST - Old St Paul's
THURS 21 AUGUST - The Piano, Christchurch
FRI 22 AUGUST - The Tuning Fork, Auckland

For more information please visit www.jennymitchell.co.nz.

ABOUT JENNY MITCHELL
NZ Best Country Artist Winner and 2 x Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny Mitchell, is a storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand with impactful songs full of grace and grit. Her last album ‘Tug of War’ included the pivotal release of the 2022 APRA NZ Best Country Song ‘Trouble Finds a Girl’ and was described by Rolling Stone as an album, “worthy of every award it will inevitably collect.”

No stranger to the road, Jenny was recently awarded a scholarship to perform at Nashville’s iconic AmericanaFest and has toured Australia and New Zealand extensively over the last decade - supporting artists including Fanny Lumsden (AU), Tami Neilson (NZ) and Nadia Reid (NZ) along the way. Her most recent touring project, The Bush & the Birds Tour, travelled throughout NZ in support of conservation organisation; Forest & Bird. An ode to her late Grandfather’s love of the land, the tour generated over $2000 in donations for Forest & Bird.

Jenny grew up in a home and family of music and often tours with her sisters, The Mitchell Twins, and country music loving Dad, Ron Mitchell. After growing up with a musical diet of The Chicks, Hank Williams and Dolly Parton, Jenny penned her first songs at the age of 11 after a trip to Ireland where she connected with her Irish heritage and explored the immigration story of her Irish born Grandparents. A few years down the track, Jenny performed original work on the TV show New Zealand's Got Talent, was placed 3rd and went onto crowdfund and release her first album at the age of 15. In 2017, she was crowned the overall winner of the NZ Gold Guitar Awards which kickstarted the professional chapter of her career, leading to her Aotearoa Music Award Winning album 'Wildfires’ produced by Tasmania’s Matt Fell.

With a sound that No Depression describes as, “poetry that dominates a beautiful melody,” Jenny Mitchell is comfortable with a country twang or softly spoken ballad and is rapidly capturing fans across the globe.

The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. id: Greta O'Leary - River Dark Album Release Tour-Sacred Heart Church, Featherston, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Greta O'Leary - River Dark Album Release Tour
description:
This August 23rd join alt-folk songwriter Greta O'Leary (trio) for one intimate and special show at Sacred Heart Church, Greytown, performing O’Learys debut record 'River Dark'.

‘A folk-rooted aesthetic that feels almost gothic’ (RNZ).

Taking her brand new album on tour for the first time this winter, Greta O'Leary performs 'River Dark' across the motu in celebration of its release. 'River Dark' is O'Leary's debut. ‘Tender, steadfast and unraveling’, it shot to #9 on the Aotearoa Official Albums Chart, features the SRN #1 singles 'Baby I'm a Singer' and 'Baptised at the Desktop Computer' and has been featured by RNZ, the SRN and Rolling Stone Magazine. O’Leary will be joined in Pōneke by her trio, Amy Borovich (HINA, Anna Coddington) and Nava Tekela-Pule (Erny Belle, LEAO).

Tāmaki Makaurau singer-songwriter and musician GRETA O'LEARY writes with clarity of vision, making introspective observations that seamlessly interlock with her spare, spacious and enthralling songcraft. Through soaring instrumentation, astute and occasionally absurd lyrics of self-reflection and her poignant voice, her debut is ‘slightly spooky, wryly funny, and expertly written’ (Tony Stamp).

Celebrated local songwriter GRETA O'LEARY is releasing her highly anticipated debut album RIVER DARK. The obscure, dreamlike record was created alongside producer Jol Mulholland at LAB Studios, with Greta's hypnotic songwriting and unmistakable vocals accentuated through the skillful musicianship of instrumentalists Cass Basil (Tiny Ruins, The Veils), Alastair Deverick (Boycrush), Callum Passells (Hans Pucket) and Anita Clark (Motte). Listeners are invited deeper into Greta’s immersive and enthralling world.

“My first record, a collection of personal, ridiculous and truth telling songs. It took a long time to get here. I was a child shy and unclear, completely confused, absolutely not onboard with future, with goals or activity. I was in the field below the house, I was at the pond with the dog, I played make believe longer than most. I was taught to be quiet.”

*****************************************

River Dark the album - https://music.drm.co.nz/river-dark

Baby I’m a Singer Music Video (Greta O’Leary) -
https://youtu.be/Wjy8xmq6JKs?si=c5xnXtxQ6-Yfzk5x

The obscure, dreamlike record was created alongside producer Jol Mulholland at LAB Studios, with Greta's hypnotic songwriting and unmistakable vocals accentuated through the skillful musicianship of instrumentalists Cass Basil (Tiny Ruins, The Veils), Alastair Deverick (Boycrush), Callum Passells (Hans Pucket) and Anita Clark (Motte). *****************************************

Goodnight My Darling is the vision and project of up and coming Te Whanganui a Tara based singer-songwriter Maxine Macaulay. With elements of shoegaze, folk and dreamy melody, Macaulay says her ever evolving vibe is a poetic expression of her life and the places around her. Her songs take you on a cinematic journey, while her ethereal vocals lull you into a quiet sense of peace and appreciation. Her 2022 nine-track self-titled album, is a mix of soul-stirring tunes including ode to love, loss and rebirth ‘The Carriage’, ‘Until I Return’ and the story of a relationship’s end in ‘The Trees Have Eyes’.

Since 2022 GMD has released singles ‘Ruby’ and ‘The Empress’ speaking to
creative repression, Motherhood and female empowerment. Joining her for her first show since becoming a Mother are band Mitch Kirk, Kim Andrews, Bella Florence and Shaun Blackwell (Hemi Hemingway & John the Baptist). With plans to further morph and develop her experiential sound, Goodnight My Darling is certainly one to watch.

id: Danica Bryant + The Band: The Feast Tour-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
name: Danica Bryant + The Band: The Feast Tour
description:
Join the 'Feast' with Danica Bryant and her iconic three-piece not-a-girl-band! This live show celebrating the release of Bryant's debut album is the band's third national tour, sure to be a pop-rock party for the ages.

A pop-folk singer-songwriter with a gritty rock-edge, Danica Bryant's music tackles provocative themes from celebrity culture to neurodiversity through an unabashedly queer feminist lens.

Her “playful indie pop” (Rolling Stone) has seen her open for legends like Elton John and Robbie Williams, hit #2 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart with her 2024 release ‘Acid’, and undergo mentorship with Kiwi icon Bic Runga. Performing alongside Tyler Blythe and Nat Bennett as a three-piece not-a-girl-band, Bryant has undergone multiple successful New Zealand tours and played festivals including Gardens Magic, Outfield and Cuba Dupa.

With her “venomous yet passionate” debut album (Ambient Light), Danica is an unabashedly fresh voice on the pop music scene. This is a meal you don't want to miss.

WELLINGTON SUPPORT FROM KINGSTON ROSE

id: Agatha Pantha and BDSN With A Side Of Don And Beans-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar

Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. Fronted by singer and ukelele player Mo Blishen, and filled out with Kent Hogan on guitar, Nik Straughier on bass and Sam King on drums, Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.

Joining them are fellow Wellington Band BDSN, fronted by Nigel Parry. Satirical songs with a hard edge and soft centre, a bit like a box of chocolates. Joined by Scott Pilgrim, Darrel Greaney and Ben McHardy.

Special guests Don and Beans provide folky ballads of love and loss to start the night off.

Something for everyone.
